meanings.definition: To fill with a crowd or multitude.
meanings.sent1: The small room was becrowding with excited children during the party.
meanings.sent2: People started becrowding the streets to catch a glimpse of the parade.
meanings.sent3: The bus stop was becrowding with commuters trying to get to work on time.
meanings.sent4: The shelves in the store were becrowding with colorful toys, making it hard to choose.
meanings.sent5: The stadium was becrowding with cheering fans, creating a lively atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To press together in a crowd.
meanings.sent1: The passengers becrowding the train platform, eager to board the arriving train.
meanings.sent2: The protesters becrowding the square, chanting slogans for change.
meanings.sent3: The students becrowding around the teacher, eager to hear the exciting news.
meanings.sent4: The trees becrowding the path, creating a natural tunnel of greenery.
meanings.sent5: The books becrowding the shelves, waiting to be explored by curious readers.
